title: Komodo dragon
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| komodo dragon l [![Komodo dragon.png](/images/1/16/Komodo_dragon.png)](/File:Komodo_dragon.png) |                                                                                    |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [HP](/Hit_points "Hit points")                                                                  | 29-59                                                                              |
| [HD](/Hit_dice "Hit dice")                                                                      | 8                                                                                  |
| [XP](/XP "XP")                                                                                  | 362                                                                                |
| [Speed](/Monster_speed "Monster speed")                                                         | 10 (swim: 60%)                                                                     |
| [AC](/Armour_class "Armour class")                                                              | 7                                                                                  |
| [EV](/Evasion "Evasion")                                                                        | 8                                                                                  |
| [Will](/Willpower "Willpower")                                                                  | 40                                                                                 |
| Attack1                                                                                         | 34 ([bite](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour")) |
| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                                         | [rDrown](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation")                                             |
| [Vulnerabilities](/Vulnerability "Vulnerability")                                               | None                                                                               |
| [Habitat](/Habitat "Habitat")                                                                   | Amphibious                                                                         |
| [Intelligence](/Monster_intelligence "Monster intelligence")                                    | [Animal](/Category:Animal_intelligence "Category:Animal intelligence")             |
| [Uses](/Item_usage "Item usage")                                                                | [Uses nothing](/Category:Uses_nothing "Category:Uses nothing")                     |
| [Holiness](/Holiness "Holiness")                                                                | [Natural](/Category:Natural_holiness "Category:Natural holiness")                  |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An enormous monitor lizard more than capable of preying on large animals.***“The three of us were sitting ashen faced as if we had just witnessed a foul and malignant murder. At least if we had been watching a murder the murderer wouldn't have been looking us impassively in the eye as he did it. Maybe it was the feeling of cold unflinching arrogance that so disturbed us. But whatever malign emotions we tried to pin on to the lizard, we knew that they weren't the lizard's emotions at all, only ours. The lizard was simply going about its lizardly business in a simple, straightforward lizardly way. It didn't know anything about the horror, the guilt, the shame, the ugliness that we, uniquely guilty and ashamed animals, were trying to foist on it. So we got it all straight back at us, as if reflected in the mirror of its single unwavering and disinterested eye.” -Douglas Adams, “Last Chance to See”. 1990. |

## Useful Info

**Komodo dragons** are somewhat dangerous lizards with a vicious bite. They are commonly found in [the Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair") and around its entrance.

Komodo dragons are a species of reptile, not an actual [dragon](/Dragon "Dragon"). They don't have a [breath](/Breath "Breath") attack and aren't affected by [Wyrmbane](/Wyrmbane "Wyrmbane")'s [dragon slaying](/Dragon_slaying "Dragon slaying") brand.

## Tips & Tricks

- Komodo dragons can prove dangerous for characters first entering the Lair. Soften them up from a distance, particularly if you have [poison](/Poison "Poison") available.
- Heavily armored characters can go toe-to-toe with them relatively easily, though their bites can still take a sizable chunk of HP off. Consider backing away if you encounter them with another threat, like a herd of [yaks](/Yak "Yak") or a [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra").
- Alternatively, if you lack the killing power to take them out swiftly, this is a perfect time to exercise discretion and leave it for later. It moves as fast as the average player on land, so escaping before the fight breaks out shouldn't be too hard.

## History

- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), komodo dragons did less damage, but could quickly make you extremely [sick](/Sick "Sick").
html:
Komodo dragon

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
komodo dragon l 
HP 29-59
HD 8
XP 362
Speed 10 (swim: 60%)
AC 7
EV 8
Will 40
Attack1 34 (bite: plain)


Resistances rDrown
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Amphibious
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type giant lizard, komodo dragon
Flags Cold-blooded
An enormous monitor lizard more than capable of preying on large animals.

“The three of us were sitting ashen faced as if we had just witnessed a foul and malignant murder. At least if we had been watching a murder the murderer wouldn't have been looking us impassively in the eye as he did it. Maybe it was the feeling of cold unflinching arrogance that so disturbed us. But whatever malign emotions we tried to pin on to the lizard, we knew that they weren't the lizard's emotions at all, only ours. The lizard was simply going about its lizardly business in a simple, straightforward lizardly way. It didn't know anything about the horror, the guilt, the shame, the ugliness that we, uniquely guilty and ashamed animals, were trying to foist on it. So we got it all straight back at us, as if reflected in the mirror of its single unwavering and disinterested eye.”
-Douglas Adams, “Last Chance to See”. 1990.

Useful Info

Komodo dragons are somewhat dangerous lizards with a vicious bite. They are commonly found in the Lair and around its entrance.

Komodo dragons are a species of reptile, not an actual dragon. They don't have a breath attack and aren't affected by Wyrmbane's dragon slaying brand.

Tips & Tricks

  • Komodo dragons can prove dangerous for characters first entering the Lair. Soften them up from a distance, particularly if you have poison available.
  • Heavily armored characters can go toe-to-toe with them relatively easily, though their bites can still take a sizable chunk of HP off. Consider backing away if you encounter them with another threat, like a herd of yaks or a hydra.
  • Alternatively, if you lack the killing power to take them out swiftly, this is a perfect time to exercise discretion and leave it for later. It moves as fast as the average player on land, so escaping before the fight breaks out shouldn't be too hard.

History

  • Prior to 0.15, komodo dragons did less damage, but could quickly make you extremely sick.

{{version031}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Komodo dragons''' are somewhat dangerous lizards with a vicious bite. They are commonly found in [[the Lair]] and around its entrance.

Komodo dragons are a species of reptile, not an actual [[dragon]]. They don't have a [[breath]] attack and aren't affected by [[Wyrmbane]]'s [[dragon slaying]] brand.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Komodo dragons can prove dangerous for characters first entering the Lair. Soften them up from a distance, particularly if you have [[poison]] available.
*Heavily armored characters can go toe-to-toe with them relatively easily, though their bites can still take a sizable chunk of HP off. Consider backing away if you encounter them with another threat, like a herd of [[yak]]s or a [[hydra]].
*Alternatively, if you lack the killing power to take them out swiftly, this is a perfect time to exercise discretion and leave it for later. It moves as fast as the average player on land, so escaping before the fight breaks out shouldn't be too hard.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.15]], komodo dragons did less damage, but could quickly make you extremely [[sick]].
